question: I have had Hashimotos Thyroiditis all my life.  I also have many neurological disorders since I entered my senior years.  The most painful and sleep-depriving is PLMT (Painful Legs Moving Toes Syndrome).  This is a very rare neurological disorder that is relatively unknown and is the cause of many nights of no sleep and a good deal of pain.In addition I have Restless Legs Syndrome and pheriphal neuropathy and now diabetes.  Most neurologists do not know nor have they heard of PLMT and there is no known cause or cure.I saw an abstract on the web regarding a connection one neurologist made whereby he attributed the PLMT to his patient's having had Hashimotos Thyroiditis.  Most of the research I have located online is years old.How many of you...if any...have Painful Legs Moving Toes and also Hashimotos?  If any of you do I would be so interested in learning how your neurologist is treating you.Kathy
title: Hashimotos and PLMT Syndrome
